resources.string: The Guinness Storehouse is located at St. James Gate Brewery. It was first opened in 2000 and is Ireland’s most popular tourist attraction with 1.6 million visitors last year.

Christ Church Cathedral is located in the city centre and a five minutes walk from O’Connell Bridge. It dates back to 1030 and home to Dublinia, a Medieval Museum that teaches Dublin’s History during this period.
Trinity College is in the heart of the city at College Green and is easily accessible by bus or walking. It was first built in 1592 and is ranked 88th in the top 100 world universities.

Croke Park is located north of the River Liffey. It is Europe’s third largest stadium (83,200 cap.) and is the headquarters of the GAA. Gaelic Football and Hurling games are played here on a regular basis.
\nLuas is a tram/light rail system in Dublin, Ireland, which in 2016 carried 34.2 million passengers.

\nDublin Bus is the biggest public transport provider in the Greater Dublin Area operating over 136 routes. Normal services run from 5.00am until midnight. The Nitelink service operates from midnight until 4.00am on Friday and Saturday nights.
\nIrish Rail operates city and commuter services in Dublin and Cork as well as intercity services throughout Ireland.
\nBus Éireann (Irish Bus) is a bus and coach operator providing services throughout the Republic of Ireland.
\nLynk is Dublin’s only taxi app that sends you a proper legal taxi with a garda vetted driver. No exceptions.
\nDublinia is a historical recreation museum and visitor attraction in Dublin, Ireland, focusing on the Viking and Medieval history of the city.
\nDublin Zoo , in Phoenix Park, Dublin, is the largest zoo in Ireland, and one of Dublin\'s most popular attractions.
